intro: Senecio sandwithii, commonly known as the Sandwith's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the United States, specifically found in California. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves with a silvery coating. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
